intro: Ceropegia cyperifolia, commonly known as the Cyperus-leaved Ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Ceropegia cyperifolia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
